title: If you were just a disembodied consciousness, would you be the same person you are today? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, because consciousness is essentially spiritual, mental and emotional, and physical consciousness it's just a secondary effect of that psychological identity. Those who have had near-death experiences report that they find, when out of the body, but they are the same person as before but with new powers and possibilities inherent in the spiritual worlds. The nature of personal identity in the near-death experience: Paul Brunton and the ancient tradition. Soul, Spirit and the Near-Death Experience

I am happy to be an embodied consciousness as it happens. If I lost my body I would be dead, now I believe in reincarnation so all is not lost. I am reminded of The Importance of Being Earnest - to lose one parent is unfortunate to lose both smacks of carelessness. I know some people who claim to channel disembodied spirits, hesitate to call them friends. My own spirit I have embraced and call part of me, I let it use my body occasionally while I just watch. We have come to an accomodation, we are friends. The difference is that I stand behind everything I say, take whatever repercussions there might be. I've just had a flash, you're not real are you. You are a bot. I’m talking to a bot. How funny is that.
